perturbation.original_text: This agreement shall be for a term of five years from the date of this document. This agreement shall renew automatically each year thereafter, unless either party serves written notice of its intention not to renew, on the other at least 90 days prior to the expiration of the then current term of this agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: This agreement shall be for a term of five years from the date of this document. This agreement shall renew each year thereafter only upon mutual written agreement by both parties, executed no less than 30 days prior to the expiration of the then current term.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies automatic renewal unless a party gives notice. The modified text requires mutual written agreement for each renewal, thereby contradicting the automatic renewal provision and creating uncertainty about the renewal process.

perturbation.original_text: KCI's Customers will receive an initial VISP web site setup including 5Mbs of storage space, maintenance of the site, technical support, and any services necessary for use of the site for no charge.
perturbation.changed_text: KCI's Customers will receive an initial VISP web site setup including 5Mbs of storage space and technical support. Maintenance of the site and any services necessary for use of the site will be subject to additional charges as outlined in Schedule A, which may be amended by Provider at its sole discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that KCI's customers receive certain services for no charge. The modified text introduces the possibility of additional charges for those same services, contradicting the 'no charge' statement and making it unclear what services are actually free.

perturbation.original_text: Confidential Information shall remain the property of the disclosing Party. A Party receiving Confidential Information shall: (1) use or reproduce such information only when necessary to perform this Agreement; (2) provide at the least the same care to avoid disclosure or unauthorized use of such information as it provides to protect it's own Confidential Information and; (3) limit access to such information to it's employees or agents who need such information to perform this agreement. Not withstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, a Party shall be allowed to disclose Confidential Information pursuant to judicial or governmental order or if otherwise required to do so by law.
perturbation.changed_text: Confidential Information shall remain the property of the disclosing Party. A Party receiving Confidential Information shall: (1) use or reproduce such information only when necessary to perform this Agreement; (2) provide at the least the same care to avoid disclosure or unauthorized use of such information as it provides to protect it's own Confidential Information and; (3) limit access to such information to it's employees or agents who need such information to perform this agreement. Provider reserves the right to disclose Confidential Information to its affiliates and subcontractors without prior consent from KCI.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause outlines strict confidentiality obligations. The added sentence allows Provider to disclose Confidential Information to affiliates and subcontractors without KCI's consent, thereby weakening the confidentiality protection and contradicting the preceding limitations on disclosure.
